titleproper.value: Guide to the Gilbert Jonas Papers <num>WAG.062</num>

author.value: Collection processed by Robert Kenselaar, 1989, and Craig Savino, 2006

publisher.value: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

addressline: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archive

creation.value: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace <date>2018-05-29T19:21:44</date>

corpname.value: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

abstract.value: The Gilbert Jonas Company, a public relations firm founded in 1962, specialized in publicity work for trade unions, in particular public employees in New York City and New York state. The firm's chief client, the American Federation of State, County and Municipal Workers, under the leadership of Jerry Wurf, hired the company to publicize organizing campaigns among New York City welfare workers and New York State public employees (including mental health care workers and police and corrections officers). The collection includes publicity materials produced by the firm, background files and clipping files, dating mostly from the 1960s.

p.value: Published citations should take the following form: <lb/><lb/>Identification of item, date; Collection name; Collection number; box number; folder number; <lb/>Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives <lb/>Elmer Holmes Bobst Library <lb/>70 Washington Square South <lb/>New York, NY 10012, New York University Libraries.
Donated by Gilbert Jonas, 1987. The accession number associated with this gift is 1987.018.

The collection will be of value to researchers interested in the history of collective bargaining by state, municipal employees in general, welfare and mental health workers, and New York State and New York City employees during the 1960s. On a broader level, the collection will is relevant to the study of how labor unions' apprroach to the area of public relations and to the history of media coverage of labor union activities.

<emph render="bold">Series II: Clipping Files, 1962-1969</emph>, contains clippings on public employees and AFSCME DC 37 and DC 50, the Hospital Aides' strike of 1968 from various print news outlets inside and outside New York City, and the Welfare Workers and their strike in 1965.

subject.value: Public relations firms |z New York (State) |z New York.
Social workers |z New York (State) |z New York.
Labor unions |x Public relations |z United States.
